description: unique identifier
number of days between registration and the earlier of death, transplantation, or study analysis time in July 1986
status of the patient C (censored), CL (censored due to liver tx), or D (death)
type of drug D-penicillamine or placebo
age in days
M (male) or F (female)
presence of ascites N (No) or Y (Yes), the accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity
presence of hepatomegaly N (No) or Y (Yes), an enlarged liver
presence of spiders N (No) or Y (Yes), spider veins are swollen, twisted veins that usually appear on the legs
presence of edema N (no edema and no diuretic therapy for edema), S (edema present without diuretics, or edema resolved by diuretics), or Y (edema despite diuretic therapy)
serum bilirubin
serum cholesterol
albumin
urine copper
alkaline phosphatase
serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase, SGOT is a protein made by liver cells
triglicerides, a type of fat (lipid) found in your blood
platelets per cubic, the cells that circulate within our blood and bind together when they recognize damaged blood vessels.
prothrombin time in seconds,  a test to evaluate blood clotting
histologic stage of disease (1, 2, 3, or 4)
